skill.name: architecture-navigator
skill.description: Understand and navigate the DevPrep AI 7-folder architecture. Use this skill when asked about code organization, where to place new features, what modules exist, or when starting development tasks that need architecture context. Auto-triggers on keywords like "where should", "add module", "architecture", "structure", "organize", "place code", "what modules".

skill.author: ArieGoldkin

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation and architecture guidance skill. Contains one read-only bash script that scans project directories using standard POSIX utilities (find, wc, basename, date). Script only reads project structure and outputs markdown summary to stdout. No network access, no file writes beyond stdout, no sensitive data handling. All 156 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES - documentation examples and standard file reading operations.

content.value_statement: Developers spend time searching for where code should go in a project. This skill provides instant architecture intelligence for the DevPrep AI codebase, including folder maps, placement rules, and validation tools.
actual_capabilities: Scan codebase to generate real-time architecture maps
Answer where should X go placement questions using a decision tree
List existing modules with file counts and purposes
Validate code organization against 7-folder structure rules
Explain import direction rules and forbidden patterns
limitations: Does not modify or write code to the filesystem
Does not execute application code or tests
Requires project root access to run scanner script

use_cases.title: Onboarding new team members
use_cases.description: New developers get instant architecture overview to understand project structure and where code belongs.

use_cases.title: Adding new features
use_cases.description: Developers building new features receive precise placement guidance for code and files.

use_cases.title: Validating architecture compliance
use_cases.description: Reviewers verify code follows the 7-folder rules and import direction patterns.

prompt_templates.title: Architecture overview
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the architecture structure of this project? What folders exist and what do they contain?

prompt_templates.title: Find module location
prompt_templates.prompt: Where does the assessment module live? What files are in it?

prompt_templates.title: Code placement
prompt_templates.prompt: Where should I add a new notification system with toast messages?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Does this code follow the 7-folder architecture rules? Check the import patterns.

output_examples.input: Where should I add OAuth authentication?
output: OAuth authentication should go in modules/auth/oauth/
- Feature-specific code not reused elsewhere ‚Üí modules/
- OAuth client SDK wrapper ‚Üí lib/oauth/client.ts for external integration
- Toast component for auth UI ‚Üí shared/components/Toast.tsx for reusable UI

output_examples.input: What modules exist in this project?
output: Feature modules: assessment, practice, questions, results, profile, home
Key locations: API in lib/trpc/, state in store/, types in types/

best_practices: Scan architecture at the start of development conversations for context
Always provide exact file paths with reasoning when answering placement questions
Reference architecture-rules.md for detailed import direction rules
anti_patterns: Placing business logic in app instead of modules
Duplicating reusable components across feature modules instead of using shared
Allowing modules to import from other modules creating forbidden dependencies

faq.question: What is the DevPrep AI 7-folder architecture?
faq.answer: A domain-driven structure with app, modules, shared, lib, store, styles, and types folders each with specific purposes.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my codebase?
faq.answer: No. The scanner only reads project structure and outputs a markdown summary. It does not write files.

faq.question: What keywords trigger this skill?
faq.answer: Phrases like where should, add module, architecture, structure, organize, place code, and what modules.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for other projects?
faq.answer: No. This skill is designed specifically for the DevPrep AI 7-folder architecture with its rules.

faq.question: How do I run the architecture scanner?
faq.answer: Execute bash ./.claude/skills/architecture-navigator/scripts/scan_architecture.sh from your project root.

faq.question: What is the import direction rule?
faq.answer: Code flows one way: app to modules to shared to lib to store to types. Modules cannot import from other modules.
